intro: Rhysospermum nervosum, commonly known as the veined rhysosperm, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, lance-shaped leaves with prominent venation. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
